name: clickhouse
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Clickhouse Cloud resources
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`clickhouse` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/ClickHouse/terraform-provider-clickhouse).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Clickhouse Cloud resources. Based on terraform-provider-clickhouse: version v0.0.10
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/ClickHouse/terraform-provider-clickhouse)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-clickhouse` repo](https://github.com/pulumiverse/pulumi-clickhouse/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-clickhouse` repo](https://github.com/ClickHouse/terraform-provider-clickhouse/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/ClickHouse/terraform-provider-clickhouse)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-clickhouse` repo](https://github.com/pulumiverse/pulumi-clickhouse/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-clickhouse` repo](https://github.com/ClickHouse/terraform-provider-clickhouse/issues).

apiUrl.description:
API URL of the ClickHouse OpenAPI the provider will interact with. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLICKHOUSE_API_URL` environment variable. Only specify if you have a specific deployment of the ClickHouse OpenAPI you
want to run against.

organizationId.description:
ID of the organization the provider will create services under. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLICKHOUSE_ORG_ID` environment variable.

tokenKey.description:
Token key of the key/secret pair. Used to authenticate with OpenAPI. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLICKHOUSE_TOKEN_KEY` environment variable.

tokenSecret.description:
Token secret of the key/secret pair. Used to authenticate with OpenAPI. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLICKHOUSE_TOKEN_SECRET` environment variable.

source.description: IP address allowed to access the service. In case you want to set the ip_access to anywhere you should set source to 0.0.0.0/0

endpointServiceId.description: Unique identifier of the interface endpoint you created in your VPC with the AWS(Service Name) or GCP(Target Service) resource

privateDnsHostname.description: Private DNS Hostname of the VPC you created

provider.description:
The provider type for the clickhouse package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

apiUrl.description:
API URL of the ClickHouse OpenAPI the provider will interact with. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLICKHOUSE_API_URL` environment variable. Only specify if you have a specific deployment of the ClickHouse OpenAPI you
want to run against.

organizationId.description:
ID of the organization the provider will create services under. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLICKHOUSE_ORG_ID` environment variable.

tokenKey.description:
Token key of the key/secret pair. Used to authenticate with OpenAPI. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLICKHOUSE_TOKEN_KEY` environment variable.

tokenSecret.description:
Token secret of the key/secret pair. Used to authenticate with OpenAPI. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLICKHOUSE_TOKEN_SECRET` environment variable.

`CLICKHOUSE_ORG_ID` environment variable.

cloudProvider.description: Cloud provider of the private endpoint ID
Cloud provider of the private endpoint ID

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Registration resources.

cloudProvider.description: Cloud provider of the private endpoint ID
Cloud provider ('aws', 'gcp', or 'azure') in which the service is deployed in.

doubleSha1PasswordHash.description: Double SHA1 hash of password for connecting with the MySQL protocol. Cannot be specified if `password` is specified.

iamRole.description: IAM role used for accessing objects in s3.

idleScaling.description: When set to true the service is allowed to scale down to zero when idle. Always true for development services. Configurable only for 'production' services.

idleTimeoutMinutes.description: Set minimum idling timeout (in minutes). Available only for 'production' services. Must be greater than or equal to 5 minutes.

ipAccesses.description: List of IP addresses allowed to access the service.

maxTotalMemoryGb.description: Maximum total memory of all workers during auto-scaling in Gb. Available only for 'production' services. Must be a multiple of 12 and lower than 360 for non paid services or 720 for paid services.

minTotalMemoryGb.description: Minimum total memory of all workers during auto-scaling in Gb. Available only for 'production' services. Must be a multiple of 12 and greater than 24.

name.description: User defined identifier for the service.

password.description: Password for the default user. One of either `password` or `password_hash` must be specified.

passwordHash.description: SHA256 hash of password for the default user. One of either `password` or `password_hash` must be specified.

privateEndpointConfig.deprecationMessage: Please use the `clickhouse.PrivateEndpoint.getConfig` data source instead.

region.description: Region within the cloud provider in which the service is deployed in.

tier.description: Tier of the service: 'development', 'production'. Production services scale, Development are fixed size.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getConfig.

cloudProvider.description: The cloud provider for the private endpoint. Valid values are 'aws', 'gcp', or 'azure'.

region.description: The region for the private endpoint. Valid values are specific to the cloud provider i.e. us-east-2

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getConfig.

cloudProvider.description: The cloud provider for the private endpoint. Valid values are 'aws', 'gcp', or 'azure'.

endpointServiceId.description: The ID of the private endpoint that is used to securely connect to ClickHouse. This is a read-only attribute.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

region.description: The region for the private endpoint. Valid values are specific to the cloud provider i.e. us-east-2
